title: Bring Back Competitive Admissions? Some NYC Middle Schools May Not.
description: After a pandemic moratorium, city leaders are letting school superintendents decide whether to bring back some admissions requirements that critics say feed racial disparities.
dc:creator: Troy Closson
media:credit: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times
media:description: The New York City schools chancellor, David C. Banks, said he would allow middle schools to resume using selective admissions, but many may not.
